net.canarymod.database.xml

Class XmlDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.canarymod.database.Database
      • net.canarymod.database.xml.XmlDatabase

  • public class XmlDatabase
extends Database
    Represent access to an XML database
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

      Inserts data into the XML file.
      void load(DataAccess data, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filters)
      This method will fill your DataAccess object with the first data set from database, that matches the given values in the given fields.
      For instance if you pass String[] {"score", "name"}
      with respective values Object[] {130, "damagefilter"},
      Canary will look in the database for records where score=130 and name=damagefilter.
      Canary will only look in the table with the name you have set in your AccessObject
      void loadAll(DataAccess typeTemplate, java.util.List<DataAccess> datasets, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filters)
      Loads all results that match the field - values given into a DataAccess list.

      Removes the data set from the given table that suits the given field names and values.
      void removeAll(DataAccess data, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filters)
      Removes the data set from the given table that suits the given field names and values.

      • load

        public void load(DataAccess data,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filters)
          throws DatabaseReadException
        Description copied from class: Database
        This method will fill your DataAccess object with the first data set from database, that matches the given values in the given fields.
        For instance if you pass String[] {"score", "name"}
        with respective values Object[] {130, "damagefilter"},
        Canary will look in the database for records where score=130 and name=damagefilter.
        Canary will only look in the table with the name you have set in your AccessObject
        Specified by:
        load in class Database
        Parameters:
        data - The class of your DataAccess object
        filters - FieldName->Value map to filter which row should be loaded
        Throws:
        DatabaseReadException

      • loadAll

        public void loadAll(DataAccess typeTemplate,
                    java.util.List<DataAccess> datasets,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filters)
             throws DatabaseReadException
        Description copied from class: Database
        Loads all results that match the field - values given into a DataAccess list.
        Specified by:
        loadAll in class Database
        Parameters:
        typeTemplate - The type template (an instance of the dataaccess type you want to load)
        datasets - DataAccess set - you can savely cast those to the type of typeTemplate
        filters - FieldName->Value map to filter which rows should be loaded
        Throws:
        DatabaseReadException

      • update

        public void update(DataAccess data,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filters)
            throws DatabaseWriteException
        Description copied from class: Database
        Updates the record in the database that fits to your fields and values given. Those are NOT the values and fields to update. Those are values and fields to identify the correct entry in the database to update. The updated data must be provided in the DataAccess
        Specified by:
        update in class Database
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be updated. Additionally this acts as information about the table schema
        filters - FieldName->Value map to filter which rows should be updated
        Throws:
        DatabaseWriteException

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll(DataAccess data,
                      java.util.Map<DataAccess,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> list)
               throws DatabaseWriteException
        Description copied from class: Database
        Updates the records in the database that fits to your fields and values given. Those are NOT the values and fields to update. Those are values and fields to identify the correct entry in the database to update. The updated data must be provided in the DataAccess
        Specified by:
        updateAll in class Database
        Parameters:
        data - the template data access used for verification.
        list - a map of data access objects to insert and the filters to apply them with
        Throws:
        DatabaseWriteException

                        DataAccess data,
                        Document dbTable,

      • elementEquals

        private boolean elementEquals(Content a,
                              Content b)
        Performs a field-by-field comparison for the two given Contents. First they must be of type Element and then the fields are checked against each other. If the number of equal fields does not match the number of child elements ot Content a, this method will return false, true otherwise
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
